DataElement.preferredName: Base Hematology Pathology Biopsy Or Aspirate Anatomic Site BiopsyOrAspirateSite
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The most important or necessary part of something.:The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.:The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, cyst, normal tissue, or tumor.:Named locations of or within the body._The anatomic site in the human body where biopsy was performed

Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, cyst, normal tissue, or tumor.:Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most important or necessary part of something.:The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.:The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Concepts.definition: The most important or necessary part of something.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Property.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, cyst, normal tissue, or tumor.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Fluid withdrawn from a body cavity, organ, cyst, or tumor.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The anatomic site in the human body where biopsy was performed

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The broad, dorsal, upper, and widest of the three principal bones composing either half of the pelvis.:A projection or projecting structure, or ridge, especially one surmounting a bone or its border.:Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.:Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.
A projection or projecting structure, or ridge, especially one surmounting a bone or its border.
The broad, dorsal, upper, and widest of the three principal bones composing either half of the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

The broad, dorsal, upper, and widest of the three principal bones composing either half of the pelvis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The long, flat bone connecting with the cartilages of the first seven ribs and the clavicle.
